title: For Sale:  Desert Eagle - 44 Mag - Mk.VII - Stainless Frame
postcontent:
1988 Magnum Research / IMI Desert Eagle - 44 Magnum - 6 1/2" Barrel - Stainless Frame (rare) ~95% condition. 8+1 Capacity. Semi-sticky combat fingered grip sleeve.

 Comes with Carrying Case, MR Cleaning / Stripping kit (new), Shoulder Holster, 3 Magazines (8 rounds ea.), Spring Rebuild Kit (new), Radocy Manual, MR Scope Mount (new), 15 Rnds. of Speer Gold Dot 240 Gr. Personal Protection 44 Magnum Ammo and an extra Hogue rubber full grip set (new) (I like the combat grip sleeve myself..).

 Excellent condition MR / IMI (Israel Military Industries) Desert Eagle. Very few rounds down the pipe in it's life. I bought it from an Air Force guy who wore it as his back-up protection for bears in Alaska. The muzzle area has some bluing loss from being in his leather holster, but nothing else wrong with this great hand cannon! I bought the soft shoulder holster to carry concealed. I've run approximately 80 rounds through it. I also bought the spring rebuild kit and field strip / cleaning kit (both new and unopened) because I like to have the 'official' parts when I need them. The Magnum Research folks say the springs should be replaced at somewhere around 3000 rounds, so I picked up a set, just to be safe.

 An important point about these DEagles is that you can NOT shoot handloads / reloads through them unless the the rounds are put through a total final sizing die. They will jam if there's any kind of case 'bulge', so have to be perfectly sized per new ammo tolerances. New ammo is the only way to go with these anyway, to assure consistent accuracy. Fully jacketed ammo is the best to use, so the gas port doesn't get fouled with lead, but semi-jacketed ammo works just as well. 

 Just so you know, the Desert Eagle was never intended to be any type of combat weapon. It's heavier than most (to lessen the recoil) for it's design purpose of being an accurate target pistol. It's amazingly accurate at up to 100 yards, and doesn't have as much recoil as you might expect. I found it VERY manageable, with pretty quick target reacquisition. I was really impressed with it! Definitely a fun shooter! Yeah, you can use it as a home defense / personal defense / concealed carry weapon too, which is what the concealed carry shoulder holster is for.... but this is not for the small handed / framed person to be able to handle quickly. If you've ever wanted a Desert Eagle, here it is! They are just plain FUN to shoot!

 Price: $800.00 (basic gun + all extra accessories)(Cheap! When compared to what they want for the new ones!!)
 Contact: (six 3 six)- 926 - three 9 seven 2 -or- email through ARMSLIST.
 Terms: Cash / FTF exchange (only) in Missouri.
 Possible Trade Considerations (straight across / based on retail): Yugo / Zastava M-76 (7.62x54R or 8mm), Romanian PSL (7.62x54R) - I need the cash mostly, so no other trades considered.

This is a used Winchester Model 1903 semi-automatic 22 rifle from the early 1900s. The serial number 33xxx puts it at the lower end of the approximate 126,000 that were manufactured
This Rifle is in near mint condition, it has not been re-blued. MP 15-22 in good condition.  Again, accessories are also nice (mags, case, foregrip, sling, etc).  I had one of these once and foolishly ended up trading it.  Now the lady friend needs to learn how to shoot and I want to get her used to the AR platform before starting to shoot 223/308.  Let me know if you have one for sale or trade!

Mosin Nagant 91/30.  I know I can get one of these anywhere for under 130.  (100 bucks at dunhams!) Hex preferred but not necessary, tula preferred but not necessary.  If you have a rare one (dragoon, finnish, etc) I might be able to pay a bit more but only if the numbers match.  I've been able to buy these for 80 bucks before so I won't shell out 150 but I'll pay a fair price (I know, 80 bucks is a steal).  Let me know what you've got.  Ammo and accessories (bayo, pouches, clips) is a plus.

Might be interested in a semiauto pocket gun.  .32 or .380, not looking for a revolver or derringer.  It'd be for pocket carry as a backup or primary in summer.  Doesn't have to be fancy.

I have a few guns I may be willing to trade and I have non-firearm stuff I can trade if you are interested.  Asking for cash is ok too though, don't hesitate.  I prefer to deal in the Columbus/Delaware area and will only drive further if it is a really good deal.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Chinese AK-47 NHM-91 w/ 380 rounds
postcontent:
NHM-91 is a chinese AK-47 made by Norinco.

It was basically produced as a RPK replica. complete with steel bipod.

-They originally came with a wooden thumb hole stock but I found it to be very awkward and uncomfortable. So I removed it and put on an adjustable folding stock with quad-rail. It makes the gun lighter and more like a typical AK-47. 

-NHM's have a longer barrel which greatly increases accuracy at long distances. (Shoots like a SKS) Also the barrel is chrome lined and double thick which keeps it much cooler than a typical AK-47. 

-This gun is no safe queen but is in very good condition. Which is why I am willing to sell it for less than the recommended $900.00 price. You can look these up on several web sites and will find them going for as much as $1100.00.

Included:
Original Wood stock
Polymer Stock w/ Quad Rail (currently on gun)
1-30 Round Steel Magazine
Steel BiPod
380 Rounds of Wolf Non-Corrosive

Total package: $825.00 obo

Will sell gun without ammo for $775.00 obo 

Must be legal and show I.D. to prove residency.

title: For Trade:  Savage model 10FP .308 with accutrigger and Leupold VX3 CDS
postcontent:
Comes with matching sling. Has fluted 22" bull barrel. Scope and barrel are matte black. More about the CDS scope below. It is an awesome feature I just don't ever use it. Still has the card in the box for a free custom dial based your ballistics. You just send them info about your weapon, what ammo you use, etc., and they send you the new dial based you your info for free. I have put one box of ammo through this rifle to sight in and shoot. Deadly accurate. I completely broke it down and cleaned it afterwards. This is pretty much a brand new weapon. I just never shoot it. 

Directly from the leupold website...

"Leupold CDS™ models allow you to quickly dial your elevation to different sight-in ranges with a custom adjustment matched to your specific ballistics information. The CDS dials change out easily, allowing you flexibility with different loads, conditions and calibers. Every CDS dial features ¼-MOA click increment finger adjustments and no adjustment covers to lose, making the VX-2, VX-3, VX-6 and VX-R even more accurate and rugged. How the CDS™ System Works The CDS System works by laser-inscribing your scope's elevation dial to match your load, velocity and conditions. Your scope will be in perfect synch with the way your rifle and load shoots, even for hand loads. Each CDS dial is unique, taking all practical ballistic and environmental factors into account."

http://www.opticsplanet.com/leupold-vx3-35-10x40mm-rifle-scope.html

Does not come with scope caps or shade. Decided to keep them for a different gun since I am not going to get any more trade value out of them, and they aren't cheap.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Chinese AK-47 NHM-91 w/ 380 rounds
postcontent:
NHM-91 is a chinese AK-47 made by Norinco.

It was basically produced as a RPK replica. complete with steel bipod.

-They originally came with a wooden thumb hole stock but I found it to be very awkward and uncomfortable. So I removed it and put on an adjustable folding stock with quad-rail. It makes the gun lighter and more like a typical AK-47. 

-NHM's have a longer barrel which greatly increases accuracy at long distances. (Shoots like a SKS) Also the barrel is chrome lined and double thick which keeps it much cooler than a typical AK-47. 

-This gun is no safe queen but is in very good condition. Which is why I am willing to sell it for less than the recommended $900.00 price. You can look these up on several web sites and will find them going for as much as $1100.00.

Included:
Original Wood stock
Polymer Stock w/ Quad Rail (currently on gun)
1-30 Round Steel Magazine
Steel BiPod
380 Rounds of Wolf Non-Corrosive

Total package: $825.00 obo
